snippet: In a strongly worded complaint, the lawyers contend that the “new G.M.” that emerged from bankruptcy in 2009 so valued cost-cutting that it “produced an inordinate number of vehicles with serious safety defects.”
abstract: Lawyers in sweeping class-action litigation against General Motors have broadened their case against the automaker, claiming that it disregarded and concealed safety issues far beyond defective ignition switch that is now linked to 27 deaths.
lead_paragraph: In a strongly worded complaint, the lawyers contend that the “new G.M.” that emerged from bankruptcy in 2009 so valued cost-cutting that it “produced an inordinate number of vehicles with serious safety defects.”

headline.main: Class-Action Case Accuses G.M. of Neglect Beyond Ignition Switch
